title: Man arrested in fatal hotel room shooting
content:
A Reno man was arrested after police say he fatally shot one victim in a hotel room early Saturday morning
At around 1:14 a.m., Reno officers responded to the report of a man that was shot in a hotel room in the 1000 block of East Sixth Street, a news release from the Reno Police Department said.
Officers found the victim and provided medical assistance until REMSA arrived and transported him to a nearby hospital. The victim, who had a single gun shot wound to the chest, later died.
According to the release, one of the people in the hotel room had a concealed firearm. The man, later identified as 23-year-old Deandre Richie, told officers he had accidentally shot the victim.
Reno Police Department Robbery and Homicide detectives investigated the scene and determined Richie was impaired while manipulating the gun that later discharged and killed the victim. According to police, the investigation determined through multiple interviews there was no altercation or malicious intent by Richie to shoot the victim.
Richie was arrested for involuntary manslaughter, possession of a stolen firearm and carrying a concealed weapon.
Anyone having information relating to this crime or the suspect(s) should contact the Reno Police Department at 334-2115, Secret Witness at 322-4900, www.secretwitness.com, or text the tip to 847411 (TIP 411) keyword - SW.
